countries.name: Afghanistan
countries.funFact: Afghanistan is the world's largest producer of opium. As of 2021, Afghanistan is the source of more than 90% of the world's opium supply. It is the source of more than 95% of the European opium supply. Opium farming is a major source of employment in Afghanistan.

countries.name: Åland Islands
countries.funFact: Despite being an autonomous region of Finland, Åland Islands' official language is actually Swedish. The students aren't even obliged to learn Finnish in school.

countries.name: Albania
countries.funFact: Only 3 million people live in the country. There are more Albanians now living outside the country than within its territories. The estimated diaspora population of Albanians is between seven to ten million.

countries.name: Algeria
countries.funFact: Algeria is the largest country in Africa.

countries.name: Andorra
countries.funFact: Andorra is the only country in the world with Catalan as its official language.

countries.name: Angola
countries.funFact: Thanks to a small exclave a near their border with the DRC, Angola is the 2nd largest producer of oil in Africa.

countries.name: Argentina
countries.funFact: Argentina Was Named for a Fabled Mountain Made of Silver

countries.name: Armenia
countries.funFact: Armenia is the first country to adopt Christianity.

countries.name: Australia
countries.funFact: The capital of Australia is Canberra, and not Sydney as others assume.

countries.name: Austria
countries.funFact: The Austrian flag dates from 1191, which makes it one of the oldest national flags in the world.

countries.name: Azerbaijan
countries.funFact: The first Muslim nation to enfranchise women.

countries.name: Bahamas
countries.funFact: The name Bahamas comes from the Spanish term 'baja mar', which means shallow sea.

countries.name: Bahrain
countries.funFact: Bahrain is an island that floats in the Persian Gulf. However, it's connected to the Saudi city of Al Khobar.

countries.name: Bangladesh
countries.funFact: Dhaka, Bangladesh capital, is the most densely populated city on Earth.

countries.name: Barbados
countries.funFact: Rihanna is originally from Barbados.

countries.name: Belarus
countries.funFact: Two Israeli presidents were born in Belarus, Chaim Weizmann and Shimon Peres.

countries.name: Belgium
countries.funFact: Belgium holds the world record for the longest period without a government

countries.name: Bhutan
countries.funFact: Bhutan is the only country in the world where tobacco is banned.

countries.name: Bolivia (Plurinational State of)
countries.funFact: Despite having no coastline, Bolivia does have a navy. It mainly patrolls the Amazon tributaries.

countries.name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
countries.funFact: Bosnia and Herzegovina has about 152 unexploded landmines per square mile (58 per square km).

countries.name: Brazil
countries.funFact: Brazil has 4 time zones.

countries.name: Brunei Darussalam
countries.funFact: Much of Shell's oil comes from offshore drilling platforms in Brunei.

countries.name: Burkina Faso
countries.funFact: Bulgaria Is The Birthplace Of Cyrillic Script, the alphabet that is used in Russian, Ukrainian and most of the Slavic languages.

countries.name: Cambodia
countries.funFact: Cambodia’s flag is the only one in the world to feature a building.

countries.name: Cameroon
countries.funFact: Before World War I, the vast majority of the country was a German colony. At that time it was known as Kamerun.

countries.name: Cabo Verde
countries.funFact: Canada is a monarchy, which is Elizabeth II.

countries.name: Cayman Islands
countries.funFact: As the Cayman Islands is a British Overseas Territory, driving is on the left-hand side of the road.

countries.name: Central African Republic
countries.funFact: The Central African Republic is home to the ethnic group of Pygmy people, known for their short stature - typically under five feet tall.

countries.name: Chad
countries.funFact: Chad is the largest of the 16 landlocked countries in Africa.

countries.name: Chile
countries.funFact: At 4,270 km (2,653 mi), Chile is the second longest country in the world, only narrowly being beat out by Brazil, which is 95 kilometers longer.

countries.name: China
countries.funFact: Put all of China’s railway lines, it can loop around the earth two times!

countries.name: Christmas Island
countries.funFact: Captain William Mynors of the Royal Mary, an English East India Company vessel, named the island when he sailed past it on Christmas Day, in 1643.

countries.name: Cocos (Keeling) Islands
countries.funFact: 'Cocos' references the vast crops of coconuts growing there. 'Keeling' is the surname of the founder of the islands, William Keeling.

countries.name: Colombia
countries.funFact: It is mandatory for radio and public television in Colombia to play the national anthem every day at 6 am and 6 pm.

countries.name: Comoros
countries.funFact: Someone attempts a coup in Comoros every 2 years.

countries.name: Congo
countries.funFact: Oil accounts for 89% of all Congo's exports.

countries.name: Congo (Democratic Republic of the)
countries.funFact: The Democratic Republic of the Congo's capital, Kinshasa, is the largest French-speaking city in the world (even above Paris).

countries.name: Cook Islands
countries.funFact: The official currency in the Cook Islands is New Zealand Dollar.

countries.name: Costa Rica
countries.funFact: Costa Rica doesn’t have a military.

countries.name: Croatia
countries.funFact: Croatia’s town of Hum, often referred to as the smallest town in the world.

countries.name: Cuba
countries.funFact: Cuba is the largest island in the Caribbean.

countries.name: Curaçao
countries.funFact: As a Netherlands overseas territory, Curaçao citizens hold the same rights to live and work in the EU as the Dutch.

countries.name: Cyprus
countries.funFact: According to the Greek Mythology, Cyprus is the birthplace of the Greek goddess of love, Aphrodite.

countries.name: Czechia
countries.funFact: Czech people are the world’s heaviest consumers of beer. On average, they drink 188.6 litres of beer per capita.

countries.name: Denmark
countries.funFact: Denmark is the world second happiest country for 2022.

countries.name: Djibouti
countries.funFact: At 155m below sea level, Lac Assal, in Djibouti is the lowest point in Africa.

countries.name: Dominica
countries.funFact: Dominica is one of only 2 countries to have purple on its flag.

countries.name: Dominican Republic
countries.funFact: The first cathedral, hospital, and university in the Americas were founded in what is now Dominican Republic capital city, Santo Domingo.

countries.name: Ecuador
countries.funFact: Ecuador's name comes from the Spanish word for the equator, which the country straddles it.

countries.name: Egypt
countries.funFact: Egyptians were the inventors of the 365-day calender. They subdivided the year into 3 seasons.

countries.name: El Salvador
countries.funFact: El Salvador is known as the “Land of the Volcanoes” because of the more than 20 volcanoes in the territory. It even has volcanoes in its flag.

countries.name: Equatorial Guinea
countries.funFact: The current capital of Equatorial Guinea is Malabo, which is located on the island of Bioko, and not the mainland. So, the government of this country is planning a new capital known as Oyala and is located in the Wele-Nzas province of the mainland region

countries.name: Eritrea
countries.funFact: Eritrea has no official language.

countries.name: Estonia
countries.funFact: Estonia has most start-ups per capita in Europe.

countries.name: Ethiopia
countries.funFact: Ethiopia was never colonised by the Europeans.

countries.name: Falkland Islands (Malvinas)
countries.funFact: Sovereignty over the Falkland Islands (Spanish: Islas Malvinas) is disputed by Argentina and the United Kingdom.

countries.name: Faroe Islands
countries.funFact: The Faroe Islands are devoid of trees. The ones that originally existed were probably cut by the first settlers and were never replanted.

countries.name: Fiji
countries.funFact: Fiji is one of the few nations to have three official languages, English, Fijian, and Fiji Hindi.

countries.name: Finland
countries.funFact: Finland is the world's happiest country.

countries.name: France
countries.funFact: Thanks to French Guiana, France's largest border is with Brazil

countries.name: French Guiana
countries.funFact: Although French Guiana is in South America, its currency is the Euro.

countries.name: French Polynesia
countries.funFact: It is believed that the word “tattoo” comes from the Tahitian (French Polynesian) word tatau and dates as far back as 1500 B.C.

countries.name: French Southern Territories
countries.funFact: The French Southern Territories has no permanently settled inhabitants.

countries.name: Gabon
countries.funFact: The name Gabon comes from the Portuguese word “gabao” meaning “cloak”. Early explorers thought the estuary of the Komo River by the capital of Libreville was the shape of a cloak.

countries.name: Gambia
funFact: With an area of only 4,300 square miles (11,500 square kilometers), The Gambia is the smallest nation in mainland Africa
The Gambia is one of only a few countries to have a 'The' behind their name. This is due to the fact that its name originates from the Gambia river.

countries.name: Georgia
countries.funFact: The Georgian language is one of the most unique languages in the world and boasts its own alphabet.

countries.name: Germany
countries.funFact: There are more football fan clubs in Germany than anywhere else in the world.

countries.name: Ghana
countries.funFact: Ghana is the second-largest producer of gold in Africa. In fact, before 1957, Ghana was commonly known as the Gold Coast because of its availability of gold along the rivers Ankobra and Volta.

countries.name: Gibraltar
countries.funFact: There is basically no tax on goods in Gibraltar. This includes cigarettes, booze, etc.

countries.name: Greece
countries.funFact: Greece has more archaeological museums and theatres than any country in the world.

countries.name: Greenland
countries.funFact: Greenland has the most northerly capital city in the world - Nuuk.

countries.name: Grenada
countries.funFact: Christopher Columbus discovered the island in 1498 and named it Concepcion. A year after that, another bunch of explorers passed by the island and changed the name to Mayo. When the French came, they changed it to “Le Grenade” and finally when the British took over, they called it Grenada.

countries.name: Guadeloupe
countries.funFact: In fact, Columbus was also the first European to see Guadeloupe! He landed there in 1493, and gave the island its name: “Santa María de Guadalupe”. The region was designated as a shrine to the Virgin Mary, venerated in Guadalupe, a Spanish town in Extremadura.

countries.name: Guam
countries.funFact: 'Where the American day begins' is the most popular slogan of Guam as this island is the first place where the sun rises on American soil.

countries.name: Guatemala
countries.funFact: Guatemala is best known as the birthplace of the Mayan civilisation and many of its ancient traditions are present across the country.

countries.name: Haiti
countries.funFact: Haiti and Canada are the only countries in the Americas with French as an official language.

countries.name: Vatican City
countries.funFact: Not only the Vatican City is smallest country in the world, it's the only county that uses Latin as its official language.

countries.name: Honduras
countries.funFact: The name translates to “great depths” in Spanish – named by Christopher Columbus after the deep waters along the coast.

countries.name: Hong Kong
countries.funFact: Hong Kong is so rich it has more Rolls Royces per person than any other city in the world

countries.name: Iceland
countries.funFact: Between 30 and 40% of Icelanders will not deny the existence of elves. Icelandic folklore is still rich with stories about the Huldufólk, meaning 'hidden people', who are said to live in the lava fields on the island.

countries.name: India
countries.funFact: India is set to surpass China as the world's most populous country in 2023, with an expected population of about 1.4 billion people.

countries.name: Indonesia
countries.funFact: Indonesia is the largest Muslim-majority nation in the world.

countries.name: Ivory Coast
countries.funFact: Ivory Coast is the largest producer of cocoa beans in the world.

countries.name: Iran (Islamic Republic of)
countries.funFact: Iran has its own calendar, which is a solar calendar, meaning that its time reckoning is based on the Earth's movements around the Sun.

countries.name: Ireland
countries.funFact: Iraq is considered the birthplace of Abraham.

countries.name: Isle of Man
countries.funFact: The island's language is Manx, otherwise known as Manx Gaelic, is an ancient language that originates from the islands Celtic past. It closely resembles that of Irish and Scottish Gaelic, but with a hint of Old Norse from when the Vikings came here.

countries.name: Israel
countries.funFact: Israel has more museums per capita than any other country in the world.

countries.name: Italy
countries.funFact: Italy is the only country to completely surround 2 countries, San Marino and Vatican.

countries.name: Jamaica
countries.funFact: The top three fastest men in the world are Jamaicans!

countries.name: Japan
countries.funFact: Japan is a highly ethnically homogenous country – 98.5% of the population is Japanese.

countries.name: Jersey
countries.funFact: Although Jersey's small size, it has one of the largest tides in the world. At low tide, twice a day, the island almost doubles in size.

countries.name: Jordan
countries.funFact: Unlike other Arab countries, Jordan does not have its own oil.

countries.name: Kazakhstan
countries.funFact: Kazakhstan provides over 50% of the world's supply of Uranium.

countries.name: Kenya
countries.funFact: Besides being home to the world’s best long-distance runners, the first woman to win a Nobel Peace Prize was from Kenya.

countries.name: Kiribati
countries.funFact: Kiribati has purchased 6,000 acres (24 sq km) of land in Fiji in case rising sea levels force the permanent evacuation of its residents.

countries.name: Kuwait
countries.funFact: The currency of Kuwait is the Kuwaiti dinar. It is the highest-valued currency unit per face value in the world.

countries.name: Lao People's Democratic Republic
countries.funFact: The Laotians consume more sticky rice than anyone else in the world.

countries.name: Latvia
countries.funFact: A Latvian-Jewish tailor named Jākobs Jufess invented the jeans we all know, wear and cannot live without now. Levi Strauss backed him financially.

countries.name: Lebanon
countries.funFact: There are more Lebanese living outside Lebanon, than within the country. Most of Lebanese live in Brazil.

countries.name: Lesotho
countries.funFact: Lesotho is one of only 3 countries to be completely surrounded by another country. The other ones are Vatican and San Marino, both surrounded by Italy.

countries.name: Liberia
countries.funFact: Liberia is the first country in Africa which had a female president. Known as Africa’s Iron Lady, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf took office as Liberia’s 24th president in 2006. She also won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2011.

countries.name: Libya
countries.funFact: The last flag of Libya was a green field and was considered the only solid colour national flag in the world during its time.

countries.name: Liechtenstein
countries.funFact: Liechtenstein is a doubly landlocked country. It is surrounded by Switzerland and Austria, which in turn is also landlocked by other European countries, making it the second doubly landlocked country after Uzbekistan.

countries.name: Lithuania
countries.funFact: Lithuania is the only country to have a national scent.

countries.name: Luxembourg
countries.funFact: Luxembourg has the highest minimum wage in the EU. However, the cost of living in Luxembourg is one of the highest in the world.

countries.name: Macao
countries.funFact: Macao has the most densely populated region on earth.

countries.name: North Macedonia
countries.funFact: Macedonia chose its name as North Macedonia because of a dispute with Greece who claimed the country can't use the name 'Macedonia' that is considered part of Greek culture.

countries.name: Madagascar
countries.funFact: Although Madagascar is located in Africa, most of its ethnic groups are from a Malayo-Indonesian origin.

countries.name: Malawi
countries.funFact: Malawi's name originates from the bordering Lake Malawi.

countries.name: Malaysia
countries.funFact: Malaysia has a unique rotating monarchy system, in which nine ethnic Malay state rulers take turns as king for five-year terms.

countries.name: Maldives
countries.funFact: According to the constitution of Maldives, only Muslims are allowed to be called citizens of the country. Any other faith apart from Islam is not allowed.

countries.name: Mali
countries.funFact: Mansa Musa, Mali's king in the 14th century, is the richest man to ever live. He had so much gold that, on a trip to Cairo, he spent 71,000 pounds (32,000 kg) of gold.

countries.name: Malta
countries.funFact: The official language of Malta is Maltese, a Semitic language derived from late medieval Sicilian Arabic with Romance superstrata. It's the only official Semitic language of the European Union.

countries.name: Marshall Islands
countries.funFact: The islands are so narrow that you will have just one road running their length. No diversion, no shortcuts, you will have only one way to follow.

countries.name: Mauritania
countries.funFact: Mauritania was the last country to abolish slavery, in 1981.

countries.name: Mexico
countries.funFact: Not Egypt, but Mexico is home to the world’s largest pyramid.

countries.name: Micronesia (Federated States of)
countries.funFact: Micronesia is one of just 22 countries not to have an army. Instead, as a former US-administered territory, the USA provides aid and is responsible for Micronesia’s defence. In return, the USA can maintain military bases in Micronesia.

countries.name: Moldova (Republic of)
countries.funFact: With an army of only 5,150 soldiers, Moldova has one of the smallest armies in Europe.

countries.name: Monaco
countries.funFact: With an average life expectancy of 89.4, it has the 2nd highest life expectancy

countries.name: Mongolia
countries.funFact: Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, is the world's coldest capital city. It has an average annual temperature of 30°F (about -1°C).

countries.name: Montenegro
countries.funFact: Montenegro declared its independence from Serbia on June 3, 2006.

countries.name: Morocco
countries.funFact: Morocco hosts the oldest continuously operating university in the world, Al-Qarawiyyin university, that was founded in 859 AD.

countries.name: Mozambique
countries.funFact: Mozambique is the only nation to feature a modern firearm on their flag.

countries.name: Myanmar
countries.funFact: In 2005, Yangon was the capital of Myanmar. The government built a new city named Naypyidaw in secret and then announced that it was the new cpaital city.

countries.name: Namibia
countries.funFact: Namibia is home to the world's oldest desert, the Namib Desert.

countries.name: Nauru
countries.funFact: Nauru is the fattest state in the world, over 71% of the country’s population is obese.

countries.name: Nepal
funFact: Nepal is home to mount Everest, the world's tallest mountain.
Nepal is the birthplace of Buddha.

countries.name: Netherlands
countries.funFact: The Netherlands was the first country to legalize same-sex marriage. The law came into effect on April 1, 2001.

countries.name: New Zealand
countries.funFact: In addition to English and sign language, Maori is also an official language in New Zealand. 17% of the country’s population is native Maori, the Indigenous people of New Zealand.

countries.name: Niger
countries.funFact: The country's name comes from the Niger river flowing through the country. The river's name possibly comes from the Berber word 'Gher', meaning river.

countries.name: Nigeria
countries.funFact: Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa, with a population of over 200 million.

countries.name: Norway
countries.funFact: Norway has the most electric cars per capita in the world.

countries.name: Oman
countries.funFact: Oman is the oldest independent state in the Arab world. The ruling dynasty of Oman dates back to 1794, making it one of the oldest independent states in the Arab world. It was formerly a maritime empire. They gained independence from Portugal in 1650, a holiday that is still celebrated today.

countries.name: Poland
countries.funFact: The Castle of the Teutonic Order, located in Poland, is the largest castle in the world.

countries.name: Republic of Kosovo
countries.funFact: Despite not being a part of the EU, Kosovo still uses the euro as its official currency.

countries.name: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha
Senegal
countries.funFact: Senegal is home to the mainland's Africa westernmost point.

countries.name: Seychelles
countries.funFact: Although being very close to the coast of Africa, these islands remained uninhabited until the French arrived to the island, in 1770.

countries.name: South Africa
countries.funFact: In the 1960s and 70s, South Africa possessed nuclear weapons. They were eventually dismantled in 1989.

countries.name: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Sudan
funFact: Despites pyramids being synonymous with Egypt, Sudan has the world's most pyramids, even more than Egypt. Sudan has around 255 pyramids, while Egypt has only 188.
Prior to South Sudan's seperation from Sudan in 2011, Sudan used to be the largest country in Africa, with a total landmass of over 950,000 square miles (2.5 million square km).

countries.name: Switzerland
countries.funFact: Despite their neutrality, until 2021, all bridges connecting Switzerland to the outside world have been planted with bombs, to be blown up in case of invasion.

countries.name: syrian Arab Republic
countries.funFact: Syria's capital, Damascus, is one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities.

countries.name: Tajikistan
countries.funFact: Tajikistan has the world's largest glacier, outside of the poles. The glacier spans over 50 miles (80 km).

countries.name: Timor-Leste
countries.funFact: Timor-Leste was the first nation to gain independence in the 21st century. They actually first became independent in 1975 but were invaded and occupied soon after.

countries.name: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
Venezuela (Bolivarian Republic of)
countries.funFact: With a proven 308 billion barrels, Venezuela has the world's largest oil reserves, even above Saudi Arabia.

countries.name: Vietnam
countries.funFact: Following the death of Vietnam's first president, Ho Chi Min, they put his body on public display.

countries.name: Yemen
countries.funFact: Yemen has been in an on-going civil war since 2014, causing the death of over 350,000 people.

countries.name: Zimbabwe
countries.funFact: With 16 official languages, Zimbabwe is the country with the most official languages.
